gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem

Class RelationArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.sem.RelationArgument

  • public class RelationArgument
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the abstract constraints for a relation argument (participant).

    It defines which role can be filled with what kind of semantic items and types and whether multiple arguments with the same role are allowed.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Constructor Detail

      • RelationArgument

        public RelationArgument(java.lang.String role,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem>,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> argMap,
                        boolean multiple)
        Constructs a RelationArgument object with a given role, semantic item class/type.
        Parameters:
        role - the role this argument takes for the relation
        argMap - the map that contains semantic item classes and corresponding semantic types appropriate for this argument
        multiple - whether multiple arguments with the same role are acceptable

    • Method Detail

      • getArgumentMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem>,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getArgumentMap()
        Gets the map that contains semantic item class/semantic types allowed for this argument.

        An example is Entity. class as a key and a set that contains Protein and Gene semantic types as the corresponding value.

        Returns:
        the map that contains semantic item class/semantic types allowed for this argument

      • getRole

        public java.lang.String getRole()
        Returns:
        the role of this argument, e.g., 'Theme'

      • isMultiple

        public boolean isMultiple()
        Returns:
        whether multiple arguments of this type is allowed in a relation

      • getAllArgumentSemTypes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllArgumentSemTypes()
        Gets all allowed semantic types.
        Returns:
        all semantic types allowed as argument

      • getArgumentSemTypes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getArgumentSemTypes(java.lang.Class<? extends SemanticItem> clazz)

        Returns:
        all semantic types allowed for clazz

      • argumentSemTypeSatisfies

        public boolean argumentSemTypeSatisfies(SemanticItem arg)
        Finds out if the semantic item arg satisfies the constraints imposed by this relation argument.
        Parameters:
        arg - a semantic item
        Returns:
        true if the argument satisfies the constraints
